Posts.Content: AllyDub wrote: Hello All, There seems to be great support on this website for people who have been diagnosed with Stage III breast cancer.  I myself have been diagnosed with Stage III, 1.5cm and 24 positive nodes with ER+/PR- and HER2-.  I am going through chemo at the moment which I find difficult and will have radiation for 4 weeks after this.  I am just so scared that I am not going to get through this.  I had scans and they were all clear, thank God but can't help thinking that it is going to come back.  I am only 34 years old just married 3 years ago with no children and just feel that maybe my time is up.  I see there are lots of women on this forum who have succeeded and suppose any positive feed back would be most welcome as I am feeling very scared at the moment....... Dx 6/9/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIIC, Grade 2, 24/27 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Help welcome AllyDub marianleah

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2008 05:18AM AllyDub wrote: Thanks so much for all your support it means alot to me and hopefully with all the positive stories on this forum that I too will be able to write in a couple of years celebrating NED!!! Thanks again - really appreciate it.
Posts.Title: Help welcome AllyDub marianleah
